review_title: A great place to work, but hard to climb in technology

pros:

Great legacy
high visibility of job profile

more work load less work resources per team

pros: Large company with creative approach means the potential to be involved with a truly world-changing product or service

pros: Great people and a great work environment. The management team in my section was great. I couldn't ask for a better internship. It opened many new doors for me.

review_title: Good career path but you need to do it all yourself

- Policy to hide career band from employees

review_title: The experience from a Big one

You can get the best experience from one of the best companies around the world.
Very structured processes.
Always looking forward for new ways to improve.
cons:
Not all the people collaborate.
Sometimes is difficult to raise your voice due to the gigantic organization.

pros: Not any that I can think of
cons: The first week I was there I was told by a coworker that GE would "suck the soul" out of you.   I saw such results in many very smart, motivated people.  It was awful to watch.

pros: Many opportunities and upward mobility. Great benefits package including matching charitable contributions and tuition reimbursement. Global company with many divisions. Salaries are typically higher than the market. Commitment to quality. Processes in place to help guide the new employee. Excellent HR department.
cons: Very bureaucratic. Staggering work loads. Continuous reorganization and layoffs. Finance and paying vendors was a very long, complicated and frustrating process.

pros:
Great company
Great employees
Fantastic benefits
Lots of opportunity to learn new things
cons: Being such a large company, it's always changing and always restructuring and internal communication is lacking.  Needs to improve how things are communicated between sites

pros: Benefits, work that you don't have to think about because it's assembly work so it's just repetitive, if you are a "morning person" you will like day shift

Need strong connections to get in and to transfer to a different segment, its based on who you know not experience, education and skills.
